required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Bazedoxifene/Conjugated Estrogens Combinations In Postmenopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo- And Active-Controlled Efficacy And Safety Study Of Bazedoxifene/Conjugated Estrogens Combinations For Prevention Of Endometrial Hyperplasia And Prevention Of Osteoporosis In Postmenopausal Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether bazedoxifene/conjugated estrogens combinations are effective for the prevention of endometrial hyperplasia and for the prevention of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Screening
primary_outcome.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.

primary_outcome.measure: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Screening
primary_outcome.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA), twice during screening in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 12 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Total Hip at Screening
primary_outcome.description: BMD measurements of the total hip were acquired by DXA, twice during screening in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Total Hip at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: BMD measurements of the total hip were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 12 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Days With Breast Pain
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of days with breast pain in each 4-week period (for example, Week 1 to 4, 5 to 8) calculated as the number of days on which a participants reported breast pain divided by total number of days with data recorded multiplied by 100. Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Uterine Bleeding or Spotting
secondary_outcome.description: Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 24 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Total Hip at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMD measurements of the total hip were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 24 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

intervention.description: Subjects will take 1 capsule orally, once daily, at approximately the same time each day continuously for the duration of the study.
Subjects will take 1 capsule orally, once daily, at approximately the same time each day continuously for the duration of the study.
Subjects will take 1 capsule orally, once daily, at approximately the same time each day continuously for the duration of the study.
Subjects will take 1 capsule orally, once daily, at approximately the same time each day continuously for the duration of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Generally healthy, postmenopausal women, aged 40 to less than 65 years
- Intact uterus
- At least 12 months of spontaneous amenorrhea, OR 6 months spontaneous amenorrhea with follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) levels > 40 mIU/mL.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of oral estrogen-, progestin-, androgen-, or SERM-containing drug products within 8 weeks before screening (12 weeks for the osteoporosis substudy)
- A history or active presence of clinically important medical disease
- Malabsorption disorders

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This main study also included osteoporosis substudy only for the purpose of the assessment of relevant parameters.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg
group.description: Bazedoxifene 20 milligram (mg)/conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 international unit (IU) orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.625 mg
group.description: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/conjugated estrogen 0.625 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg/Medroxyprogesterone Acetate 1.5mg
group.description: Conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg/medroxyprogesterone acetate 1.5 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo matched to bazedoxifene/conjugated estrogen or conjugated estrogen/medroxyprogesterone acetate capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

period.title: Period Between Core Study and Extension

baseline.population: Safety analysis set included all randomly assigned participants who took at least 1 dose of test article.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Screening
outcome.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.
outcome.population: Endometrial hyperplasia at screening was an exclusion criterion and participants who had hyperplasia were not included in the analysis. Therefore this data is not available.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Screening
measure.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.
measure.population: Endometrial hyperplasia at screening was an exclusion criterion and participants who had hyperplasia were not included in the analysis. Therefore this data is not available.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Month 12
outcome.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.
outcome.population: Efficacy evaluable (EE) analysis population for Year 1: all participants who were randomized and took at least 1 dose of test article, who had a screening endometrial biopsy with readings by at least 2 blinded central pathologists, had a biopsy during Month 12, or had hyperplasia diagnosed before Month 12 and had no major protocol violations.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Month 12
measure.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). outcome.title: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Screening
outcome.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA), twice during screening in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population for BMD of lumber spine included all randomized participants took at least 1 dose of test article, and had a baseline and at least 1 on-therapy evaluation of BMD (scans acquired more than 60 days after the test article administration was stopped were excluded) at Year 1.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg

outcome.population: MITT population for BMD of lumber spine: all randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of test article, and had a baseline and at least 1 on-therapy evaluation of BMD (scans acquired more than 60 days after test article administration was stopped were excluded) at Year 1. Missing values imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF).

analysis.groups_desc: An analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model was used with treatment and center as main effects and baseline BMD and years since menopause as covariates.
An ANCOVA model was used with treatment and center as main effects and baseline BMD and years since menopause as covariates.

outcome.description: Percentage of days with breast pain in each 4-week period (for example, Week 1 to 4, 5 to 8) calculated as the number of days on which a participants reported breast pain divided by total number of days with data recorded multiplied by 100. Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.
outcome.population: MITT population for breast pain: all randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of test article, and had data available at least for 5 of 7 days at screening and 20 days for at least 1 post-baseline interval. n=participants evaluable at specified time periods for each arm, respectively.

measure.description: Percentage of days with breast pain in each 4-week period (for example, Week 1 to 4, 5 to 8) calculated as the number of days on which a participants reported breast pain divided by total number of days with data recorded multiplied by 100. Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.
measure.population: MITT population for breast pain: all randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of test article, and had data available at least for 5 of 7 days at screening and 20 days for at least 1 post-baseline interval. n=participants evaluable at specified time periods for each arm, respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Uterine Bleeding or Spotting
outcome.description: Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.
outcome.population: MITT population for uterine bleeding or spotting included all randomized participants who had received at least 1 dose of test article and had at least 1 day of on-therapy bleeding data. Imputation=LOCF. n=participants evaluable for this measure at specified time periods for each arm, respectively.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg
group.description: Bazedoxifene 20 milligram (mg)/conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 international unit (IU) orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.625 mg
group.description: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/conjugated estrogen 0.625 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg/Medroxyprogesterone Acetate 1.5mg
group.description: Conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg/medroxyprogesterone acetate 1.5 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo matched to bazedoxifene/conjugated estrogen or conjugated estrogen/medroxyprogesterone acetate capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

measure.description: Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.
measure.population: MITT population for uterine bleeding or spotting included all randomized participants who had received at least 1 dose of test article and had at least 1 day of on-therapy bleeding data. Imputation=LOCF. n=participants evaluable for this measure at specified time periods for each arm, respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Month 24
outcome.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.
outcome.population: EE analysis population for Year 2 included all randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of test article, participated in study extension, had a screening endometrial biopsy with readings by at least 2 blinded central pathologists, had biopsy during Month 24, or had hyperplasia diagnosed before Month 24 and had no major protocol violations.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg
group.description: Bazedoxifene 20 milligram (mg)/conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 international unit (IU) orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.625 mg
group.description: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/conjugated estrogen 0.625 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg/Medroxyprogesterone Acetate 1.5mg
group.description: Conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg/medroxyprogesterone acetate 1.5 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo matched to bazedoxifene/conjugated estrogen or conjugated estrogen/medroxyprogesterone acetate capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Month 24
measure.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.
measure.population: EE analysis population for Year 2 included all randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of test article, participated in study extension, had a screening endometrial biopsy with readings by at least 2 blinded central pathologists, had biopsy during Month 24, or had hyperplasia diagnosed before Month 24 and had no major protocol violations.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Month 24
outcome.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 24 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.
outcome.population: MITT population for BMD of lumber spine: all participants who took at least 1 dose of test article, participated in study extension, and had a baseline and at least 1 on-therapy evaluation of BMD (scans acquired more than 60 days after the test article administration was stopped were excluded) at Year 2. Missing values imputed using LOCF method.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg
group.description: Bazedoxifene 20 milligram (mg)/conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 international unit (IU) orally once daily up to Year 2.

Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg/Medroxyprogesterone Acetate 1.5mg
group.description: Conjugated estrogen 0.45 mg/medroxyprogesterone acetate 1.5 mg capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo matched to bazedoxifene/conjugated estrogen or conjugated estrogen/medroxyprogesterone acetate capsule orally once daily at approximately the same time each day continuously up to Year 1 during the core study and up to Year 2 during the study extension. Participants also received Caltrate plus D tablet containing calcium 600 mg and vitamin D 200 IU orally once daily up to Year 2.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Month 24
measure.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 24 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.
measure.population: MITT population for BMD of lumber spine: all participants who took at least 1 dose of test article, participated in study extension, and had a baseline and at least 1 on-therapy evaluation of BMD (scans acquired more than 60 days after the test article administration was stopped were excluded) at Year 2. Missing values imputed using LOCF method.

analysis.groups_desc: An ANCOVA model was used with treatment and center as main effects and baseline BMD and years since menopause as covariates.
An ANCOVA model was used with treatment and center as main effects and baseline BMD and years since menopause as covariates.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Bazedoxifene 20 mg/Conjugated Estrogen 0.45 mg

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
